gengine.gameobject

Class MovableObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • gengine.gameobject.GameObject
        • gengine.gameobject.MovableObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Enemy, Player

    public class MovableObject
extends GameObject
    This is the base class for moving game objects. Has new attributes like speed and direction for movement and methods for them.
    Version:
    0.2
    Author:
    Lauri Pirttimaki

      The default constructor, takes coordinates and dimensions as parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovableObject

        public MovableObject()
        The default constructor. Speed is set to 0 by default. Also intializes movableDirections, which stores directions which are free to move to, and direction to NONE.

      • MovableObject

        public MovableObject(int x,
                     int y,
                     int w,
                     int h)
        The default constructor, takes coordinates and dimensions as parameters. Speed is set to 0 by default. Also intializes movableDirections, which stores directions which are free to move to, and direction to NONE.
        Parameters:
        x - - x coordinate
        y - - y coordinate
        w - - width of game object
        h - - height of game object

      • getMovableDirections

        public boolean[] getMovableDirections()
        Method returns states of free movement of all directions as a boolean array.
        Returns:
        movableDirections

      • getMovableDirection

        public boolean getMovableDirection(int index)
        Method returns the state of free movement of a single direction stored in movableDirections. The order is UP, DOWN, LEFT and RIGHT.
        Parameters:
        index - - the index of wanted direction
        Returns:
        true if direction is free for movement

      • getMovableDirection

        public boolean getMovableDirection(Direction d)
        Method returns the state of free movement of a single direction stored in movableDirections. The order is UP, DOWN, LEFT and RIGHT. If none of the four directions is given method returns false.
        Parameters:
        d - - direction you want to check
        Returns:
        true if direction is free for movement

      • update

        public void update(java.util.List<GameObject> objects,
                   long delta)
        Base method for handling logic. This includes collision, movement and other actions. The logic follows: 1. check where object can move 2. move to direction 3. check for collision a. if there is collision specifically to BLOCK type object, move next to it. so there won't be overlapping.
        Overrides:
        update in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        objects - - all of the related objects
        delta - - the time between frames

      • canMove

        public boolean[] canMove(java.util.List<GameObject> objects)
        Method checks if game object can move to any of the four directions and returns array containing their states.
        Parameters:
        objects - - all the related objects
        Returns:
        a boolean array for movableDirection

      • move

        public void move(Direction d,
                 long time)
        Moves the game object.
        Parameters:
        d - - direction to move
        time - - time between frames

      • moveNextTo

        public void moveNextTo(GameObject obj)
        Method moves game object to side of other game object accordingly to direction.
        Parameters:
        obj - - object you want to move next to

      • collides

        public GameObject collides(Direction d,
                           java.util.List<GameObject> objects,
                           long time)
        Method checks whether game object collides with other game object in specific direction. If collision was detected, it returns the collided game object, otherwise null.
        Parameters:
        d - - direction you want to check
        objects - - all related objects
        time - - time between frames
        Returns:
        collided game object and null if there was no collision
